definition: we are honored by your presence
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
surname Jia
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
light/ray/CL:道[dao4]/bright/only/merely/to use up
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

sentences.english: In particular, I'd like to thank Ms.
sentences.chinese: 我特別感謝凱蘭女士大駕光臨。

sentences.english: I opened the door, and there was Tom as big as life.
sentences.chinese: 我打開門，原來是湯姆大駕光臨。

sentences.english: I'm looking forward to seeing him on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 我期待他週五大駕光臨。

sentences.english: We look forward to welcoming you at the APDXC in Osaka, Japan.
sentences.chinese: 我們期待你大駕光臨日本大阪參加亞太地方DX大會。

sentences.english: We look forward to having you with us tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我們期待着您今晚大駕光臨。

IOU/informal document acknowledging a debt

lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
protective coloration/camouflage
